krrood.entity_query_language.match#

Classes#

AbstractMatchExpression

Abstract base class for constructing and handling a match expression.

Match

Construct a query that looks for the pattern provided by the type and the keyword arguments.

MatchVariable

Represents a match variable that operates within a specified domain.

AttributeMatch

A class representing an attribute assignment in a Match statement.

Functions#

match(...)

Create a symbolic variable matching the type and the provided keyword arguments. This is used for easy variable

match_variable(...)

Same as krrood.entity_query_language.match.match() but with a domain to use for the variable created

Module Contents#

class krrood.entity_query_language.match.AbstractMatchExpression#

Bases: typing_extensions.Generic[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], abc.ABC

Abstract base class for constructing and handling a match expression.

This class is intended to provide a framework for defining and managing match expressions, which are used to structural pattern matching in the form of nested match expressions with keyword arguments.

type_: typing_extensions.Optional[typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]] = None#

The type of the variable.

variable: typing_extensions.Optional[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]] = None#

The created variable from the type and kwargs.

conditions: typing_extensions.List[krrood.entity_query_language.entity.ConditionType] = []#

The conditions that define the match.

parent: typing_extensions.Optional[Match] = None#

The parent match if this is a nested match.

node: typing_extensions.Optional[krrood.entity_query_language.rxnode.RWXNode] = None#

The RWXNode representing the match expression in the match query graph.

resolved: bool = False#

Whether the match is resolved or not.

property expression: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]#
Abstractmethod:

Returns:

the entity expression corresponding to the match query.

resolve(*args, **kwargs)#

Resolve the match by creating the variable and conditions expressions.

property name: str#
Abstractmethod:

property id#
property type: typing_extensions.Optional[typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]#

If type is predefined return it, else if the variable is available return its type, else return None.

property root: Match#
Returns:

The root match expression.

class krrood.entity_query_language.match.Match#

Bases: AbstractMatchExpression[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]

Construct a query that looks for the pattern provided by the type and the keyword arguments. Example usage where we look for an object of type Drawer with body of type Body that has the namedrawer_1:

>>> @dataclass
>>> class Body:
>>>     name: str
>>> @dataclass
>>> class Drawer:
>>>     body: Body
>>> drawer = match_variable(Drawer, domain=None)(body=match(Body)(name="drawer_1")))
kwargs: typing_extensions.Dict[str, typing_extensions.Any]#

The keyword arguments to match against.

property expression: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.An[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]#

Return the entity expression corresponding to the match query.

update_fields(variable: typing_extensions.Optional[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable] = None, parent: typing_extensions.Optional[Match] = None)#

Update the match variable, and parent.

Parameters:

  • variable The variable to use for the match. If None, a new variable will be created.

  • parent The parent match if this is a nested match.

create_variable()#
evaluate()#

Evaluate the match expression and return the result.

property name: str#
class krrood.entity_query_language.match.MatchVariable#

Bases: Match[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]

Represents a match variable that operates within a specified domain.

A class designed to create and manage a variable constrained by a defined domain. It provides functionality to add additional constraints via keyword arguments and return an expression representing the resolved constraints.

domain: krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.DomainType = None#

The domain to use for the variable created by the match.

create_variable()#
class krrood.entity_query_language.match.AttributeMatch#

Bases: AbstractMatchExpression[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]

A class representing an attribute assignment in a Match statement.

parent: AbstractMatchExpression#

The parent match expression.

attribute_name: str#

The name of the attribute to assign the value to.

assigned_value: typing_extensions.Optional[typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Literal, Match]] = None#

The value to assign to the attribute, which can be a Match instance or a Literal.

variable: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Attribute, krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Flatten] = None#

The symbolic variable representing the attribute.

property expression: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]#

Return the entity expression corresponding to the match query.

property assigned_variable: krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable#
Returns:

The symbolic variable representing the assigned value.

property attribute: krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Attribute#
Returns:

the attribute of the variable.

Raises:

NoneWrappedFieldError If the attribute does not have a WrappedField.

property is_type_filter_needed#
Returns:

True if a type filter condition is needed for the attribute assignment, else False.

property name: str#
krrood.entity_query_language.match.match(type_: typing_extensions.Optional[typing_extensions.Union[typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]] = None) → typing_extensions.Union[typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], Match[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]#
Create a symbolic variable matching the type and the provided keyword arguments. This is used for easy variable

definitions when there are structural constraints.

Parameters:

type The type of the variable (i.e., The class you want to instantiate).

Returns:

The Match instance.

krrood.entity_query_language.match.match_variable(type_: typing_extensions.Union[typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]], domain: krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.DomainType) → typing_extensions.Union[typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.An[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], MatchVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]#
Same as krrood.entity_query_language.match.match() but with a domain to use for the variable created

by the match.

Parameters:

  • type The type of the variable (i.e., The class you want to instantiate).

  • domain The domain used for the variable created by the match.

Returns:

The Match instance.
